articles.author: Gram Slattery, Andrew Goudsward, Patricia Zengerle, Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump chose loyalists with little experience for several key cabinet positions on Wednesday, stunning some allies and making clear that he is serious about reshaping - and in some cases testing - America's institutions.
articles.title: Trump taps loyalists with few qualifications for top jobs

articles.author: Anthony Boadle, Andre Romani
articles.description: Brazil's Supreme Court was evacuated after two nearby explosions on Wednesday night that left one dead in a square near Congress and the presidential palace, police said, stirring security concerns shortly before the country hosts the G20 summit.
articles.title: Brazil's top court evacuated after explosions leave one dead ahead of G20

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Joe Biden will host President-elect Donald Trump at the White House on Wednesday for a meeting designed to demonstrate a smooth transition between administrations despite Trump's team not yet having signed documents to start the handover process.
articles.title: Biden, Trump to meet at White House for transition talks after Harris defeat

articles.author: John Irish, Francois Murphy
articles.description: The resolution would task the IAEA with issuing a "comprehensive report" on Iran's nuclear activities, which would put further focus on Iran's failure to explain uranium traces found at undeclared sites.
articles.title: Exclusive: European powers pushing for resolution against Iran at IAEA, diplomats say

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will meet Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping for likely the final time on Saturday, senior administration officials said, as Beijing prepares for a potentially more confrontational period with Washington under Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden, Xi to meet on Saturday in Peru, US officials say

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: The role is key to the president-elect's plans to carry out mass deportations, pardon Jan. 6 rioters and seek retribution against those who prosecuted him over the past four years.
articles.title: Trump taps firebrand congressman Matt Gaetz for attorney general

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: Taiwan does not have a "concrete list" of new arms deals to put to the United States' incoming Trump administration but is keen to discuss how to boost the island's defence, senior Taiwan security officials said.
articles.title: Taiwan has no arms shopping list for Trump but keen to discuss, Taiwan security officials say

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: European Union foreign policy chief Josep Borrell has proposed that the bloc suspend a political dialogue with Israel, citing possible human rights violations in the war in Gaza, according to four diplomats and a letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: EU's Borrell proposes suspending Israel dialogue over Gaza war concerns

articles.author: Stephanie Burnett
articles.description: Police detained pro-Palestinian protesters rallying in central Amsterdam on Wednesday in defiance of a ban imposed after violence stemming from a football match between Ajax and Israeli club Maccabi Tel Aviv.
articles.title: Police detain pro-Palestinian protesters defying Amsterdam ban

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said on Thursday his government would not block the International Criminal Court (ICC) if former leader Rodrigo Duterte wishes to be investigated over alleged crimes against humanity in his bloody anti-drugs crackdown.
articles.title: Philippines Marcos' says will not block ICC if ex-president Duterte wants to be investigated
